elevator.rmi.impl
Class ElevatorImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.impl.ElevatorImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Door, Elevator, Motor, java.rmi.Remote, Scale, java.io.Serializable
public class ElevatorImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Elevator

The class ElevatorImpl implements the remote interface elevator.rmi.Elevator that is used for controlling a motor, a scale (level indicator) and a door of an elevator via RMI. The Elevator remote interface can be used to start moving the elevator up or down, to close/open the elevator's door, to set/get a value of the scale of the elevator, to get a current position of the elevator. The getElevator() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the Elevator object. For example: 

    MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
    Elevator e3 = MakeAll.getElevator(3);
    double where = e3.whereIs();
    e3.up();
    do {
      e3.setScalePosition((int)where);
      sleep(10);
    } while ((where = e3.whereIs()) < 4.999)
    e3.stop();
    e3.setScalePosition(5);
    e3.open();
    sleep(3000);
    e3.close();

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Elevator, Motor, Door, Scale, Serialized Form

whereIs

public double whereIs()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: Motor
Returs a current position of the elevator moved with this motor.
Specified by:
whereIs in interface Motor
Following copied from interface: elevator.rmi.Motor
Returns:
a double position of the elevator in "floor units". For example, the value 2.5 "floor units" means that the elevator is located exactly in between the 2nd and 3rd floors.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
down, stop, up
